subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Paul an apostle of Christ Jesus by the will of God, to the saints in Ephesus, the faithful in Christ Jesus. (Eph. 1:1) NIV
reflection: "Faithful followers of Christ Jesus" ~ What an excellent reputation! Such a label would be an honor for any believer. What would it take for others to characterize you as a faithful follower of Christ? We need to hold fast to our faith one day at a time: faithfully obeying God, in every detail of our lives. Then, like the Ephesians, we will be known as a person who is faithful to the Lord.
prayer: Help me to be sensitive to Your leading, that I may be characterized as a faithful follower. Help me to trust in You for every detail of my life. Amen.
original_content:
09/04/08~~~~(food for thought)~~~The best way to get even is to forget...(Lk.6:35)

Our Bible Verse for Today:

Paul an apostle of Christ Jesus by the will of God,
to the saints in Ephesus, the faithful in Christ Jesus.
(Eph. 1:1) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

"Faithful followers of Christ Jesus" ~ What an excellent reputation!
Such a label would be an honor for any believer...

What would it take for others to characterize you as a faithful follower 
of Christ? 

We need to hold fast to our faith one day at a time: faithfully obeying 
God, in every detail of our lives...

Then, like the Ephesians, we will be known as a person who is faithful 
to the Lord...

Our Prayer for Today:
Help me to be sensitive to Your leading, that I may be characterized 
as a faithful follower. Help me to trust in You for every detail of my
life...Amen.

Keep looking up, all things are possible 
if we only believe...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Grace and peace to you from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ. Praise be to the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who has blessed us in the heavenly realms with every spiritual blessing in Christ. (Eph. 1:2, 3) NIV
reflection: "Who has blessed us with every spiritual blessing in the heavenly realms" means that in Christ we have all the benefits of knowing God ~ being chosen for salvation, being adopted as His children, forgiveness, insight, the gifts of the spirit, power to do God's will, the hope of living forever with Christ. Because we have an intimate relationship with Christ, we can enjoy these blessings now. The "heavenly realm" means that these blessings are eternal not temporal. The blessings come from Christ's spiritual realm. For more information on the heavenly realms in this letter look to 1:20, 2:6, 3:10. These passages reveal Christ in His victorious, exalted role as ruler of all.
prayer: Dear Lord Jesus, I thank You for the gift of grace that You have bestowed upon each believer. I thank You for the many heavenly blessings that we receive through faith in You. Amen.
original_content:
09/05/08~~~(food for thought)~~~People don't care how much you know,
until they know how much you care...(Phil. 2:3)

Our Bible Verses for Today:

Grace and peace to you from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ...

Praise be to the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who has blessed 
us in the heavenly realms with every spiritual blessing in Christ...(Eph. 1:2, 3) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

"Who has blessed us with every spiritual blessing in the heavenly realms" 
means that in Christ we have all the benefits of knowing God ~

being chosen for salvation, being adopted as His children, forgiveness, insight, 
the gifts of the spirit, power to do God's will, the hope of living forever with Christ...

Because we have an intimate relationship with Christ, we can enjoy these blessings
now. 

The "heavenly realm" means that these blessings are eternal not temporal. The
blessings come from Christ's spiritual realm...

For more information on the heavenly realms in this letter look to 1:20, 2:6, 3:10.
These passages reveal Christ in His victorious, exalted role as ruler of all...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Lord Jesus, I thank You for the gift of grace that
You have bestowed upon each believer. I thank You for 
the many heavenly blessings that we receive through 
faith in You...Amen.

Keep looking up, He's got the whole world in His hands...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: For He chose us in Him before the creation of the world to be holy and blameless in His sight. (Eph. 1:4) NIV
reflection: Paul says that God "chose us" this is to emphasize that salvation depends totally on God. We are not saved because we deserve it but because God is gracious and freely gives salvation. We did not influence God's decision to save us, He save us according to His plan. SO, there is no way to take credit for our salvation or to allow room for pride. The mystery of salvation originated in the timeless mind of God long before we existed. It is hard to understand how God could accept us. BUT because of Christ, we are holy and blameless in His sight. Yes, God chose us, and when we belong to Him through Jesus Christ, God looks at us as if we had never sinned. All we can do is express our thanks for His wonderful love.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I could say thanks every day for the wonderful gift of salvation, but it would never suffice for this wonderful gift, and Your wonderful love. Help me to be better witness of Your grace and mercy. Amen.
original_content:
09/06/08~~~(food for thought)~~~Humor is to life what shock absorbers
are to cars...(Pro. 17:22)

Our Bible Verse for Today:

For He chose us in Him before the creation of the world
to be holy and blameless in His sight...(Eph. 1:4) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Paul says that God "chose us" this is to emphasize that salvation
depends totally on God. We are not saved because we deserve
it but because God is gracious and freely gives salvation...

We did not influence God's decision to save us, He save us 
according to His plan. SO, there is no way to take credit for our
salvation or to allow room for pride...

The mystery of salvation originated in the timeless mind of God
long before we existed. It is hard to understand how God could
accept us...

BUT because of Christ, we are holy and blameless in His sight.
Yes, God chose us, and when we belong to Him through Jesus
Christ, God looks at us as if we had never sinned...

All we can do is express our thanks for His wonderful love...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I could say thanks every day for
the wonderful gift of salvation, but it would never suffice
for this wonderful gift, and Your wonderful love. Help me 
to be better witness of Your grace and mercy...Amen.

Keep looking up, be an example of His love...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: He predestined us to be adopted as His sons through Jesus Christ, in accordance with His pleasure. (Eph. 1:5) NIV
reflection: He "predestined us" is another way of saying that salvation is God's work and not our own doing. In His infinite love, God has adopted us as His own children. Though Jesus' sacrifice, He has bought us into His family and made us heirs along with Jesus (Romans 8:17). In Roman law adopted children had the same rights and privileges as biological children. Even if they had been slaves. Paul uses this term to show how strong our relationship to God is. Have you entered into this relationship with God?
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for Your infinite love, for without Your plan I would be lost, for as Isaiah says my works are but filthy rags. Bless all my e-mail friends with good health and safety this week. Amen.
original_content:

Though Jesus' sacrifice, He has bought us into His family and made

Paul uses this term to show how strong our relationship to God is. Have

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for Your infinite love,

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: In Him we have redemption through His blood, the forgiveness of sins, in accordance with the riches of God's grace That He lavished on us with all wisdom and understanding. (Eph. 1:7-8) NIV
reflection: God showered His kindness on us ~ that is called God's "grace". This is His voluntary and loving favor given to those He saves. We can't earn salvation, nor do we deserve it. No religious, intellectual, or moral effort can gain it, because it comes only from God's mercy and love. Without God's grace, no person can be saved. To receive it, we must acknowledge that we cannot save ourselves, that only God can save us, and that our only way to receive this loving favor is through faith in Christ. .
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You again today for Your love and mercy, for without it I would be lost for all eternity. Help me remove myself from the busyness of each day to look up and give You thanks. Amen.
original_content:
09/10/08~~~(food for thought)~~~It isn't your position that makes you happy
or unhappy, it's your disposition...(I Tim. 6:6, 7)

Our Bible Verse for Today:

In Him we have redemption through His blood, the forgiveness of sins,
in accordance with the riches of God's grace

That He lavished on us with all wisdom and understanding...(Eph. 1:7-8) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

God showered His kindness on us ~ that is called God's "grace". This is
His voluntary and loving favor given to those He saves...

We can't earn salvation, nor do we deserve it. No religious, intellectual, or 
moral effort can gain it, because it comes only from God's mercy and love...

Without God's grace, no person can be saved. To receive it, we must acknowledge 
that we cannot save ourselves, that only God can save us, and that our only
way to receive this loving favor is through faith in Christ....

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You again today for Your love
and mercy, for without it I would be lost for all eternity. Help
me remove myself from the busyness of each day to look
up and give You thanks...Amen.

Keep looking up ~ that's all He asks...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: And He made known to us the mystery of His will according to His good pleasure, which He purposed in Christ, to be put into effect when the times will have reached their fulfillment ~ to bring all things in heaven and on earth together under one head, even Christ. (Eph. 1:9, 10) NIV
reflection: God was not intentionally keeping His plan secret, but His plan for the world could not be fully understood until Christ rose from the dead. His purpose for sending Christ was to unite Jews and Gentile in one body with Christ as the head, Many people still do not understand God's plan; but at the right time, He will bring us together to be with Him forever. Then everyone will understand. On that day, all people will bow to Jesus as Lord, either because they love Him or because they fear His power (See Philippians 2:10, 11).
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for Your wonderful plan to one day bring all people together to worship You the One True God. Help me become a better witness that I might have a hand in making this message clear to more people. Keep looking up, for Godly wisdom. Amen.
original_content:

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: In Him we were also chosen, having been predestined according to the plan of Him who works out everything in conformity with the purpose of His will, in order that we, who were the first to hope in Christ, might be for the praise of His glory. (Eph. 1:11, 12) NIV
reflection: It has, and always will be, God's purpose to offer salvation to the world, which He planned since the beginning of time. God is sovereign, He is in charge. Oh so often our lives seem to become chaotic, but we can always rest in this truth: Jesus is Lord, and God is in control. God's purpose to save you cannot be thwarted, no matter what evil Satan may bring.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You that no matter how chaotic my life may seem, I still have this one abiding truth ~ "You are Lord, and still in control." I pray that today I would remain obedient to Your leading, so that there would be some order to my life. Amen.
original_content:

You are in the prayers of two who care...
